de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.common
Interface SupportOperations

All Superinterfaces:
Component, OperationCallback
All Known Subinterfaces:
Application, DHTNode, DistributionStrategy, OverlayNode, UnstructuredOverlay
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractApplication, AbstractOverlayNode, BTClientApplication, BTPeerDistributeNode, BTPeerSearchNode, BTTrackerApplication, BTTrackerNode, ClientNode, DistributionStrategyImpl, FileSharingClient, ServerNode
public interface SupportOperations
extends Component, OperationCallback

Components implement this interface to receive the operation's result (mainly overlays and applications do this). This means they can create new operations from the configuration data (via the createOperation method) and can provide methods with OperationCallback as parameter. Additionally, this component must implement the OperationCallback interface to be informed itself about the operation status.

There is a contract how the public method of components with operations should look like: Each method using an operation internally should accept an operation callback as its last interface and return the operation's id, e.g. public int foo(OperationCallback callback); or public int foo2(Object someParam; OperationCallback callback); where the returned value is the operation's id.

Version:
0.3, 27.11.2007
Author:
Sebastian Kaune , Konstantin Pussep
See Also:
Operation, OperationCallback

Method Detail

createOperation

Operation createOperation(java.lang.String opName,
                          java.lang.String[] params,
                          OperationCallback caller)
Create an appropriate Operation. The component checks whether it can create an operation with the given name and number of parameters. This method is used only to specify operations via configuration (action) files.

Parameters:
opName - - operation name
params - - operation parameters if required.
caller - - caller Object which will be informed when the operation finishes (successfully or with a failure)
Returns:
operation - created (can be scheduled or executed immediately)
